meanings.sent1: He was fired from his job for being late too often.
meanings.sent2: The boss fired the employee for not following company policies.
meanings.sent3: After being fired, he decided to pursue his passion for painting.
meanings.sent4: Losing his job felt like being fired into the unknown.
meanings.sent5: The news of his firing spread like wildfire in the office.

meanings.sent1: The soldier fired his gun during the training exercise.
meanings.sent2: The police officer fired a warning shot to stop the criminal.
meanings.sent3: The cowboy fired his revolver in the air to celebrate.
meanings.sent4: The sound of gunfire echoed as they fired into the distance.
meanings.sent5: The hunter fired a single shot, hitting the target accurately.

meanings.sent1: She fired up the oven to bake a delicious cake.
meanings.sent2: The chef fired the pizza in the wood-fired oven.
meanings.sent3: The aroma of freshly fired bread filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The cookies were perfectly golden after being fired in the oven.
meanings.sent5: The baker fired the pastries until they were crispy and golden.

meanings.sent1: He fired up the grill to cook some burgers.
meanings.sent2: The arsonist fired the building, causing chaos in the city.
meanings.sent3: The campers fired up the bonfire to roast marshmallows.
meanings.sent4: The dry leaves quickly fired up when exposed to the flame.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display fired up the night sky with colors.
